intro: Haloragis isomera, commonly known as the silverleaf flax. It is a flowering plant native to southern Africa, particularly South Africa. The plant is characterized by its silver-gray foliage and produces small, yellowish flowers. It thrives in coastal areas and sandy soils, often found in dune environments. Haloragis isomera is a low-growing perennial herb with a compact, mat-like growth habit.
